sentence.Network_en: The young man worked hard in emulation of his famous father.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位年轻人努力工作,要迎头赶上他出名的父亲.

sentence.Network_en: His spirit of assiduous study is worthy of emulation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他刻苦钻研的精神,值得效法.

sentence.Network_en: The socialist emulation drive in our factory is really lively.
sentence.Network_cn: 咱们厂的社会主义劳动竞赛搞得真热火.

entry.def: If you emulate something or someone, you imitate them because you admire them a great deal.

example.ex: Sons are traditionally expected to emulate their fathers.
example.tran: 历来认为儿子会仿效父亲。

means.word_mean: 2. (computer science) technique of one machine obtaining the same results as another
3. effort to equal or surpass another

auth_sentence.content: Mathematics describes the world in the same way computers simulate it -- through emulation, or imitation.

auth_sentence.content: That drew a sharp response from some Chinese officials who consider Taiwan a renegade province hardly worthy of emulation.
